page.title: 08Employment in the Ufton Area
page.content: The pattern of employment has not changed significantly since an earlier enquirey by schoolchildren in 1969. As in 1969 the main occupations of residents employed in the area are connected with farming. This does not apply to more than a dozen people, however,since the majority commute to employment in the larger towns of Coventry; Royal Leamington Spa and Warwick amongst others. The closure of the School and Petrol Station has further reduced the possibility of local employment since 1969. Apart from agriculture some part-time work is available at the local public house whilst the garage; boarding kennels and riding stables employ two or three others.
